Summary Note:
Joséphine Jade Moreau and the RM are childhood friends, having attended the same schools and shared many life experiences. Their enduring friendship has laid a solid foundation for their business relationship.
 Joséphine Jade Moreau is a 57 year old Curator from France. She has a diverse background, having worked in various capacities and gained extensive knowledge in the field.
Julius Baer's exceptional client service and bespoke financial solutions were the main reasons she decided to join.
Family Background: Joséphine Jade Moreau is currently divorced. She does not have any children.
Education Background:
Joséphine received her secondary school diploma from Lycée René Descartes in 1985.
 Joséphine completed her university education at La Fémis in 1991.
Occupation History:
Joséphine Jade Moreau is a seasoned professional with over 34 years of experience.
At Musée Rodin,  Joséphine Jade Moreau held the position of Art Dealer from 1991 to 1995, developing essential skills in the field.
After gaining experience, she took on the role of Gallery Owner at Centre Pompidou in 1995, further expanding her skill set.
Her tenure as a Art Advisor at Musée Rodin from 2001 to 2002 was marked by significant achievements and a deepening understanding of the field.
She worked as a Curator at Louvre Museum from 2004 till now, playing a pivotal role in shaping the company's vision and strategy.
Wealth Summary:
During her work, she focused on financial growth, making diverse investments and ultimately saving 1000000 EUR.
Her remarkable portfolio comprises 3 stunning properties. Situated in prime locations across Lille, Nantes and Toulouse, these assets demonstrate their sophisticated understanding of real estate investments and high-end lifestyle preferences.
She inherited a significant sum of 1620000 EUR from her grandmother, a respected Oil and Gas Executive, in 2015, which she has wisely invested.
Client Summary: The RM knows the client very well and is a good friend of the entire family.
